issue.body:

This should be the function signature and not the hash of the function:
https://github.com/enigmampc/surface/blob/develop/src/tests/test_worker.py#L36

issue.title: Faulty Quote Attestation

comments.author: andrewtam
comments.body: Bumping this as it needs to be fixed by Monday.

comments.body:
OK. Try with the new versions. this shouldn't happen anymore. if it does please tell us(with logs of course) and we'll reopen this :)
Thanks!

issue.body:
I'm currently trying to run Surface and I'm getting this error:

[2018-07-31 17:24:20.035948] DEBUG: main: config not found in the `.enigma` directory: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '/Users/andrew/.enigma/config.json'
[2018-07-31 17:24:20.039471] INFO: main: Starting up node.
[2018-07-31 17:24:20.039903] INFO: Node: Connecting via zmq to: tcp://ibm.enigma.co:10006
[2018-07-31 17:24:20.040122] INFO: Node: Asking Core for SGX Report
[2018-07-31 17:24:21.801885] INFO: Node: {'errored': False, 'quote': '', 'address': '0x7947a090a1d43c60d2358d782cb207de0f7a4fb8'}
[2018-07-31 17:24:21.802947] INFO: Node: Quote was faulty, trying again. Attempt 1 of 3...
[2018-07-31 17:24:21.803152] INFO: Node: Asking Core for SGX Report
[2018-07-31 17:24:21.831414] INFO: Node: {'errored': False, 'quote': '', 'address': '0x7947a090a1d43c60d2358d782cb207de0f7a4fb8'}
[2018-07-31 17:24:21.831723] INFO: Node: Quote was faulty, trying again. Attempt 2 of 3...
[2018-07-31 17:24:21.831818] INFO: Node: Asking Core for SGX Report
[2018-07-31 17:24:21.859318] INFO: Node: {'errored': False, 'quote': '', 'address': '0x7947a090a1d43c60d2358d782cb207de0f7a4fb8'}
[2018-07-31 17:24:21.859887] INFO: Node: Quote was faulty, trying again. Attempt 3 of 3...
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "./src/surface/__main__.py", line 189, in <module>
    start(obj={})
  File "/Users/andrew/anaconda/envs/py36/lib/python3.6/site-packages/click/core.py", line 722, in __call__
    return self.main(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/Users/andrew/anaconda/envs/py36/lib/python3.6/site-packages/click/core.py", line 697, in main
    rv = self.invoke(ctx)
  File "/Users/andrew/anaconda/envs/py36/lib/python3.6/site-packages/click/core.py", line 895, in invoke
    return ctx.invoke(self.callback, **ctx.params)
  File "/Users/andrew/anaconda/envs/py36/lib/python3.6/site-packages/click/core.py", line 535, in invoke
    return callback(*args, **kwargs)
  File "./src/surface/__main__.py", line 90, in start
    results_json['quote'], server=ias_proxy)
  File "/Users/andrew/Desktop/Andrew/secret-contracts/surface/src/surface/communication/ias/quote.py", line 74, in from_enigma_proxy
    result = response.json()['result']
KeyError: 'result'

comments.author: fredfortier
comments.body: @andrewtam What are the expected values of `callable_args` when decrypted (`[?],[1],[?]`)?

comments.author: andrewtam
comments.body:
[1], [1], [1]

Key:
[pollID], [voteValue], [weight]

comments.author: moriaab
comments.body:
After RLP decode I get the following values: ( [3], [encrypted value], [1] ).
After decryption of the encrypted value, I get decimal number 49, which is ascii code of "1". Since the type is uint, the value is understood as integer. What exactly was encrypted: decimal number 1 or string "1"?

comments.author: andrewtam
comments.body: Decimal number 1

comments.author: moriaab
comments.body: I did the encryption of b"1" and 1. The received encrypted value of the vote is equal to the encryption of b"1" and not 1.

comments.author: andrewtam
comments.body: What should I change to get the encrypted value of 1?

comments.author: elichai
comments.body:
How did you encrypt?
Try doing
```
const engUtils = require ('../lib/enigma-utils');
let encrypted = engUtils.encryptMessage (derivedKey, 1);
```
Make sure you're doing 1 and not "1", I think you can check using something like `typeof a == 'number'`
`

comments.author: andrewtam
elichai
comments.body:
Ok, So for some reason Javascript's Buffer doesn't recognize Numbers unless you use a special function.
So when you tried encrypting a number you actually encrypted an empty buffer 
(while resulting in 49 still means encrypting a string of 1)

I made a new commit to fix this. but when using numbers we should start using [bn.js]( https://github.com/indutny/bn.js) to support accurate 256bit numbers.
https://github.com/enigmampc/enigma-contract/commit/a33cce103e414d089855bc48cb75712f1c80b15f

comments.author: elichai
comments.body: Added BN.js support: https://github.com/enigmampc/enigma-contract/commit/cdc6aa36e3771214ca53fa63b54ebc865127f9f3

comments.author: andrewtam
comments.body: Can you give an example of usage? I tried doing `let encryptedVote = getEncryptedVote(new BN(1));` but got the error "The message is not a string or a number".

comments.author: elichai

comments.author: moriaab
comments.body: Thanks, I am working on this defect.

comments.author: moriaab
comments.body:
Hi Andrew,
Unencrypted addresses as inputs revealed some defect in core, which I fixed. Still there is a problem. I guess that the addresses are delivered as bytes,  in which case there will be no difference between lower case and upper case letters in the address. So the correct way to deliver address is string.

comments.author: andrewtam
comments.body: Have you tried testing it yet? I'm still getting an error.

comments.author: moriaab
comments.body: Sorry, my fault. I pushed the new fix. It is in enigma-core in development branch. Please tell me if it works. Thank you.

pr.author: elichai
pr.title: Replacing the existing encryption key, and adding new test
pr.body:
As stated here: https://github.com/enigmampc/enigma-core/pull/5 I replaced the args in the tests to match the new key.
And I added a new test for a billionaire smart contract: https://github.com/enigmampc/enigma-contract/pull/1

pr.author: elichai
pr.title: Handle an ethereum address instead of pubkey
pr.body:
This is required after the changes in `enigma-core` Iin this PR: https://github.com/enigmampc/enigma-core/pull/6
Because now it receives an Ethereum address instead of a public key.

This too can't be merge before coordinating with the Dapp JS.

pr.author: elichai
pr.title: Implementing Simulation Mode
pr.body:
This means `Surface` will ignore the report because when it's in simulation mode the report is full of A's.
This needs adjusting in https://github.com/enigmampc/enigma-contract

pr.author: lacabra
pr.title: BLD: retrying 3 attempts for faulty quote
pr.body: Adding 3 attempts to get a non-faulty quote (those containing all `A`s) from core.

pr.author: fredfortier
pr.title: Updating crypto library

comments.author: fredfortier
comments.body: Noticed that gpc sign was disabled. Recreated the commit and pushed to master directly.

pr.body: Current version has a security vulnerability
